sermons.title: 1 Cor 13 (version 1)
sermons.description: This sermon focuses on God's kind of love from the verses written by Paul in 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5:5. The majority of the sermon discusses the first half of 1 Cor 13; specifically verses 1 through 8. There are many old hymns and writings quoted by Brother Len that focus on the person and love of God and His Christ intertwined in the message, quite a few from Wesley. There is also some time spent on some of the past saints that exemplified this love.

sermons.title: 1 Cor 13 (version 2)
sermons.description: This sermon focuses on God's kind of love from the verses written by Paul in 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5:5. The majority of the sermon discusses the first half of 1 Cor 13; specifically verses 1 through 8. There are many old hymns and writings quoted by Brother Len that focus on the person and love of God and His Christ intertwined in the message, quite a few from Wesley. There is also some time spent on some of the past saints that exemplified this love.

sermons.title: Behaviors That Bind Us
sermons.description: Why are people discontent, even though they are saved by the grace of God? What shackles are binding their behavior? In 1 Corinthians 13:11, Paul helps us understand the reasons for our discontent which often originates from the child still within us. Dr. Stanley discusses those childish things that may adversely influence our lives as an adult, including believing you must measure up to another's expectations, the need for instant gratification, and (believe it or not) throwing temper tantrums.

sermons.title: Christ In Us by Erlo Stegen
sermons.description: Erlo Stegen delivers a heart searching message on the person of Christ. Woe to us who have God's Word and are not transformed to hear and obey it. Sundar Singh said that salt dissolved in water may disappear but it doesn't cease to exist. We may be sure of its presence by tasting the water. Likewise the indwelling Christ may be realised by His love He imparts to us.

sermons.title: Christ in us
sermons.description: Woe to us who have God's Word and are not transformed to hear and obey it. Sundar Singh said that salt dissolved in water may disappear but it doesn't cease to exist. We may be sure of its presence by tasting the water. Likewise the indwelling Christ may be realised by His love He imparts to us. Jesus said that He is the Way, the Truth and the Life. When you have Him you've found the way. When you have Him you have the Truth and abundant life. If Christ is a reality to you He leads and guides you. Everybody who tastes you will experience Christ.

sermons.title: Gifts of the Holy Spirit - Part 2
sermons.description: With careful attention to Biblical context, McGee shares some thought-provoking words about the gift of tongues, including his personal observations of the Charismatic movement.   He also explains what is the most important  and most needed gift today.

sermons.title: Hope
sermons.description: This one is a gem! Parkyns revives the power of HOPE, a word seen frequently in scripture.  Hope can strengthen a wavering faith. Hope is the path to healing. When combined with love, hope can restore the one near death. Hope keeps us from sinking into despair. Hope keeps us looking forward to a righteousness that we can never experience until the next life.

sermons.title: How To Make This The Best Summer
sermons.description: Want to make this the best summer ever? In this teaching Pastor Cymbala presents three Biblical instructions that can change your life.

sermons.title: Love-Portrait of Christ and the Christian
NO LONGER LOVELESS
sermons.description: We should all be able to see God at work in our lives - especially in our relationships with our family and at work. How many times our love and patience are tried during the day! And how many times do we fall flat on our faces! But God can transform everything. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: REDEEMED TO LOVE
sermons.description: God transforms people who by nature only think about themselves and their advantages and welfare. He redeems them into loving, sympathetic people who make other people's lives rich and happy. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: The Greatest Thing In The World
sermons.description: God is love. Pastor Cymbala explores what this really means and how we should live out this life of love as a follower of Christ.

sermons.title: The Reality Of The Love Of Jesus Christ
sermons.description: Corrie Ten Boom shares her testimony of walking with the Lord Jesus 75 for years. Her times of struggle in terrible persecutions and imprisonment. What joy and happiness she has recounting her life and walk with the Lord Jesus.

sermons.title: United in love
sermons.description: Jesus said in John 13:35, “By this all will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another.” God's children have this mark upon them, that they have fervent love for one another. When one of the members suffers, the others have compassion on that person as if they are suffering themselves. We must be one in the things of the Lord; one in humility, accepting God's Word and applying it to our lives and obey it. We cannot claim to be of one heart when there is division and each one pulls his or her own way. If we are not united then there is something wrong in our midst. We must even be united in our thoughts, and in what we hate. If there is no hatred in your life towards sin and abhorrence for the world, you are rotten and good for nothing in God's Kingdom. You must hate the world and the things of the world – the lust of the eyes, the lust of the flesh and the pride and haughtiness of life.

sermons.title: What Is Love? The Root of Self-Seeking
sermons.description: Brother Brian shares about the love of God. He defines it Biblically and gives many examples of how much love means to God and each believer. He exhorts us to seek and pursue love above all things. Love is not selfish, he shows clearly that the root of love is not self-seeking. A great challenging message to all of us.
